alert.note: Alert for Bristol; Middlesex; Norfolk; Plymouth; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 06 at 9:25AM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Connecticut, Massachusetts and northern Rhode Island, including the following counties, in northern Connecticut, Windham. In Massachusetts, Bristol, Middlesex, Norfolk, Plymouth and Worcester. In northern Rhode Island, Providence. * WHEN...Until 415 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 923 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Local fire department in Holliston reported a portion of route 126 in the vicinity of Concord St was flooded. In addition, several rivers and streams are experiencing rises due to continued rain and runoff from previous rain. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen since yesterday. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Worcester, Brockton, Newton, Framingham, Taunton, Woonsocket, Marlborough, Shrewsbury, Cumberland, Natick, Randolph, Franklin, Needham, North Attleborough, Norwood, Milford, Wellesley, Stoughton, Bridgewater and Attleboro. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
